Name: ISOAMYL ACETATE
Description: Isoamyl acetate is the acetate ester of isoamylol. It has a role as a metabolite and a Saccharomyces cerevisiae metabolite. It is functionally related to an isoamylol.

plant_concentrations.References: (1) Dr. Duke's Phytochemical and Ethnobotanical Databases. Plants with a chosen chemical. Isoamyl aceate. Washington, DC: US Dept Agric, Agric Res Service. Available from, as of June 12, 2015: https://www.ars-grin.gov/duke/
plant_concentrations.Value: Isoamyl acetate detections in various plants(1).

environmental_bioconcentrations.Value: An estimated BCF of 14 was calculated in fish for isoamyl acetate(SRC), using a  log Kow of 2.25(1) and a regression-derived equation(2). According to a classification scheme(3), this BCF suggests the potential for bioconcentration in aquatic organisms is low(SRC).

environmental_biodegradations.References: (1) Lamb CB, Jenkins GF; pp. 326-9 in Proc 8th Indus Waste Conf: Purdue Univ  (1952) (2) NITE; Chemical Risk Information Platform (CHRIP). Biodegradation and Bioconcentration. Tokyo, Japan: Natl Inst Tech Eval. Available from, as of June 22, 2015: https://www.safe.nite.go.jp/english/db.html (3) Price KS et al; J Water Pollut Contr Fed 46: 63 (1974)
environmental_biodegradations.Value: AEROBIC: Biodegradation studies with isoamyl acetate were not available(SRC, 2015). Structurally similar compounds such as butyl acetate and isopropyl acetate have achieved 50.7 and 40.0%, respectively, of their theoretical BODs after 10 days in mineralized water and settled sanitary sewage at 20 °C(1). Butyl acetate present at 100 mg/L, reached 86% of its theoretical BOD in 2 weeks using an activated sludge inoculum in the Japanese MITI test(2). Isobutyl acetate, methyl amyl acetate, and other alkyl acetates have achieved between 69-81% of their theoretical BODs after 20 days in fresh water tests with non-acclimated sludge(3). These data suggest that biodegradation of isoamyl acetate may be an important environmental fate process(SRC).

soil_absorption_mobility.Value: The Koc of isoamyl acetate is estimated as 130(SRC), using a log Kow of 2.25(1) and a regression-derived equation(2). According to a classification scheme(3), this estimated Koc value suggests that isoamyl is expected to have high mobility in soil.
